input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line
The path and file name of the file to be searched.
Print all lines except those that contain the pattern? Valid value: true
Precede each line by the block number on which it was found? Valid value: true
Ignore upper/lower case distinctions during comparisons? Valid value: true

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">grep </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${invert pattern}') !=0 and '${invert pattern}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-v </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${print byte offset}') !=0 and '${print byte offset}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-b </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${case insensitive}') !=0 and '${case insensitive}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-i </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">$[pattern] $[file]</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/xpg4/bin/grep </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${invert pattern}') !=0 and '${invert pattern}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-v </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${print byte offset}') !=0 and '${print byte offset}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-b </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${case insensitive}') !=0 and '${case insensitive}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-i </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">$[pattern] $[file]</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">findstr </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${invert pattern}') !=0 and '${invert pattern}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/v </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${print byte offset}') !=0 and '${print byte offset}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/o </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${case insensitive}') !=0 and '${case insensitive}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/i </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">$[pattern] $[file]</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Perform File Pattern Search Searches the contents of a file for a pattern and displays any matching lines.
